skills.description: Here you can see some technologies that I have affinity. The list will be updated as I evolve and remember others' skills.

experience.octadesk: Built a chat widget that connects with other company projects, helping other squads by fixing their bugs, developing a mobile and desktop chat application.
experience.ambevTech: I started to develop a platform to connect, manage and track several DevOps features from Azure and others.
experience.seniorSistemas: I worked on a business management system as a frontend developer, creating new features and fixing bugs. Also, I have created a new app for managers, that integrates with Senior's solutions.

aboutMe.resume:
I had always wanted to work with technology. When I was a child, I remember that my first contact with this universe was on a Tibia server that I created to play with my friends and it ended up working out vey well. In those days, I didn't think that this area was really for me. Many years later, the fate led me to meet a JAVA course, where I completed a small application with JAVA, MySQL, JS, HTML, and CSS as my final project, which sparked my interest in programming.

 Since then, I have specialized in frontend development, primarily using JS frameworks such as Angular, React, Vue, and Svelte. I also did some works with Ionic and Flutter.

 I love getting to know new technologies, testing concepts and seeing the things working. I have been gaining experience in DevOps, Backend and UI/UX areas. I intend to do more projects related to these areas, to reinforce my knowledge and learn new things.

aboutMe.title: This project (About me)
aboutMe.description:
This project was create with objective of telling a bit about myself, my habilities, experiences, curiosities and also to present some project that I will be developing.

 I believe that this project can evolve into more topics in the future.

vueWeatherChallenge.title: Vue Weather Challenge
vueWeatherChallenge.description:
This project aimed to meet a challenge, where a page was created to present weather information for specific cities. 

 The layout and design of the project align with the challenge's proposal.

nextjsCoinChallenge.title: Nextjs Coin Challenge
nextjsCoinChallenge.description:
This project was developed to meet a challenge.

 It's a Cryptos project with real data on a specific date. In the future, it can be improved to have real-time data. I'm using SSR in it, although SSG and even SPA could be used in some cases, since the data is static through the API available at /api/coins, I'm only using SSR.

 The layout and design of the project align with the challenge's proposal.

vueGiphyChallenge.title: Vue Giphy Challenge
vueGiphyChallenge.description:
This project was developed to meet a short-term challenge of approximately 1 day.

 Here, I developed a system that fetches GIFs from an external API. It is possible to search for specific GIFs and by categories. Also, you can click on a GIF to view it in a larger resolution and be able to copy its sharing link.

 Something cool that I implemented is that you can load countless GIFs without losing performance in the browser.

angularCalendarChallenge.title: Angular Calendar Challenge
angularCalendarChallenge.description:
This project was developed to meet a short-term challenge and was completed in approximately 3 days.

 Here, we have a simulation of a calendar with appointment scheduling and drag and drop functionality to change the date and time of appointments. You can create a new event on the schedule by clicking on 'Create' or by clicking on a specific time on the calendar days.

 This project uses Nx, which is a build system, and the application was built using the Component First Architecture. Some project configurations are located in src/app, but the core of the application is in libs/calendar/src/lib/.

angularPlatformChallenge.title: Angular Platform Challenge
angularPlatformChallenge.description:
This project was developed to meet a short-term challenge of approximately 1 day.

 Several components were created in the project using Bootstrap and can be found in the folder src/app/components.

 The layout and design of the project align with the challenge's proposal.
